div.head: For engraving on iron
div.ab: One ℥ of verdet, ii ℥ of coarse salt & a little sublimate, or else grind massicot with linseed oil, and u cover this the quite clean & polished blade or iron with it, & let dry in the fire or in the sun, and draw on it what you please. Then, to engrave it & make the water, take a liard’s worth of verdet, & put in twice as much coarse salt, & about four grains of sal ammoniac, & six grains of sublimate, & the water ought not to be hot.
